DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Treatment Arm Type Code ArmType
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A specific treatment protocol used in a clinical trial._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.:A system, often of numbered categories, for representation of data._The code that describes the specific experimental group.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A specific treatment protocol used in a clinical trial._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.:A system, often of numbered categories, for representation of data.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A specific treatment protocol used in a clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A specific treatment plan within a clinical trial that describes the activities a subject will be involved in as he or she progresses through the study.

Property.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.:A system, often of numbered categories, for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC released per model owner approval.  mc 2/2/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The code that describes the specific experimental group.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A therapeutically active agent, treatment regimen or procedure that is intended to provide baseline measurements for the experimental protocol of a clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutically active agent, treatment regimen or procedure that is intended to provide baseline measurements for the experimental protocol of a clinical trial.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being studied; investigational; derived by experimentation.

Concepts.definition: Being studied; investigational; derived by experimentation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Use of an inactive compound identical in appearance to drug or treatment being tested in experimental research, which may or may not be known to the physician and/or subject, administered to distinguish between drug action and suggestive effect of the drug or treatment under study. The effects of the active drug or treatment are compared to the effects of the placebo.:A specific treatment plan within a clinical trial that describes the activities a subject will be involved in as he or she progresses through the study.

Concepts.definition: Use of an inactive compound identical in appearance to drug or treatment being tested in experimental research, which may or may not be known to the physician and/or subject, administered to distinguish between drug action and suggestive effect of the drug or treatment under study. The effects of the active drug or treatment are compared to the effects of the placebo.
A specific treatment plan within a clinical trial that describes the activities a subject will be involved in as he or she progresses through the study.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.
